result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon T Stadler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon T Stadler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon T Stadler was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Brandon T Stadler was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brandon T Stadler
Current: 442 Broadway St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 20000 W. Pinecrest Ln, New Berlin, WI 53146 United States

8:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by DA - agreement has been reached, upon plea to counts 1 & 3, State will dismiss count 2.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Statement by Felicia S.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNTS 1 & 3 (EACH COUNT)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS (EACH COUNT):

-Domestic Violence Assessment and any follow-up
-Anger Management Assessment and any follow-up
-Court costs & Domestic Abuse Surcharge
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 8:59 a.m.

8:41 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney.  Court will set for Status Hearing on November 30, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:42 a.m.

9:09 A.M.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney. Defendant to meet with the public defender today.  Court sets for Status Hearing on November 16, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:11 a.m.

9:47 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney and have not been able to reach the Public Defender.  Court sets for Status Hearing on October 27, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:48 a.m.

8:50 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 20, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:51 a.m.

No Contact with Felicia S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

No Contact with Felicia S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

11:32 a.m.  Defendant in custody present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and NO CONTACT with Felicia S for 72 hours.  Statement by the Clerk.  Court orders No Contact with Felicia S until conclusion of the case.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant to return to court for Initial Apeparance on October 6, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:35 a.m.
